caseName: Rembaum v. Banco Santander, S.A.
party: Investec Trust as Trustees of the Flamenco Trust

recap_documents.description: OPINION AND ORDER re:#100920 50 MOTION to Dismiss / Defendants' Notice of Motion to Dismiss Certain Federal Securities Fraud Claims in Fourth Amended Class Action Complaint filed by Jonathan Clark, Banco Santander International, Banco Santander, S.A., Optimal Investment Services, S.A.: For the reasons set forth within, defendants' Motion to Dismiss Certain Federal Securities Fraud Claims in Fourth Amended Class Action Complaint is granted in part and denied in part. Counts XI and XIV are dismissed. Counts XIII and XV are sustained. The Clerk of the Court is directed to close this motion [Docket No. 50]. The following claims remain in this action: common law fraud, negligent misrepresentation, and gross negligence against OIS, Clark, and Banco Santander (Counts I-IV and XVI-XVII); aiding and abetting fraud against Banco Santander (Count VIII); and federal securities fraud against OIS (Count XIII), Clark (Count XII), and Banco Santander (Count XV). Defendants combined forum non conveniens motion and motion to dismiss (1) Counts I-II and VIII (as to Banco Santander only) and (2) Counts XVI-XVIII is currently pending. (Signed by Judge Shira A. Scheindlin on 10/13/2011) (ab) Modified on 10/18/2011 (jab). (Entered: 10/14/2011)

recap_documents.description: OPINION AND ORDER re: 64 MOTION to Dismiss filed by Total Gas & Power North America, Inc., 85 MOTION to Dismiss filed by Total S.A., Total Gas & Power Limited. The Court has considered all of the arguments of the parties. To the extent not specifically addressed above, they are either moot or without merit. For the foregoing reasons, the defendants motions to dismiss, ECF Nos. 64 and 85, are granted. The clerk is directed to enter judgment dismissing this action and closing the case. The Clerk is also directed to close all pending motions. (Signed by Judge John G. Koeltl on 3/25/2017) (ras) (Entered: 03/27/2017)
